result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Craig Metzner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $748.50 - to be taken from bond on deposit, with any remaining balance to be returned to bond poster.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No contact with known drug users or dealers, except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.

Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-27-22.

Court heard on factors.
Deft heard on correction to statement throughout the PSI.
Atty Skvara heard.
Court continues to speak on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 1:
1 year and 6 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence and places Deft on probation for 3 years.
Not eligible for CIP.
Eligible for SAP.
Conditions of probation:
60 days jail, without good time, but with huber release if in compliance with jail rules and regulations.
Credit for 11 days time served.
90 days jail - imposed and stayed - to be used at the agents discretion for treatment or sanction purposes.
Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $748.50 - to be taken from bond on deposit, with any remaining balance to be returned to bond poster.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
